title: Antonio Brown Enrolls in Classes at Alma Mater Central Michigan
text:
It remains to been seen whether Antonio Brown will be coming back to the NFL, but he will be going back to his alma mater, Central Michigan University.

First reported by MLive football writer Aaron McMann and confirmed by Brown himself on Instagram, the 31-year-old has enrolled in classes at the college he attended for three years (2007-09) before entering the NFL.

An image Antonio Brown shared of his class list. (Antonio Brown/Instagram)

Interestingly, Brown enrolled in classes at the school last week before he was cut by the New England Patriots, according to McMann. A spokesperson for the school confirmed Brown is enrolled in four online classes but also made it clear Brown does not attend classes on a CMU campus.

On Brown’s schedule? Introduction to Management, Technical Writing, Death and Dying (a religion course) and Racism and Equality (a sociology course).

Hopefully, none of those classes require his attention on Tuesday morning as he is scheduled to appear in a Miami-Dade County courtroom for a deposition for a civil lawsuit against him for destroying a Florida condo last year, The Detriot Free Press reports.

That civil lawsuit is not to be confused with the one which Brown’s former trainer Britney Taylor filed against him less than two weeks ago. In the suit, Taylor, who met Brown while she was also attending CMU, alleges Brown sexually assaulted her on three separate occasions.

The NFL is investigating Taylor’s claims as well as those of another woman who accused Brown of engaging in sexual misconduct at his home while she was there painting a mural. Brown’s threatening text messages to the second woman were the final straw in his dismissal from the Patriots.

For what it’s worth, Brown tweeted he is done with the NFL on Sunday.
